title: Time Travel to Ireland, 1750
description: The year is 1750 in Ireland, a time of significant change and development. As you embark on this journey, your actions will have consequences on the environment and the future of air quality. Choose wisely:

choices.text: Introduce crop rotation in agriculture to improve soil fertility without overuse.
choices.consequence: This practice reduces the need for fallow fields and decreases deforestation for agriculture, leading to less air pollution and a healthier ecosystem.

choices.text: Invest in the development of peatlands for fuel.
choices.consequence: While providing a local energy source, extensive peat extraction leads to habitat destruction and releases large amounts of carbon dioxide, worsening air quality over time.

choices.text: Support the expansion of linen manufacturing using water-powered mills.
choices.consequence: This choice promotes industrial growth with minimal air pollution compared to coal-fired production, encouraging sustainable economic development.

choices.text: Promote reforestation and the planting of native trees to offset carbon emissions.
choices.consequence: Your efforts lead to increased biodiversity, improved air quality, and the sequestration of carbon, showcasing an early understanding of ecological balance.
